text: The Visayan languages are the group languages particularly in some regions of Visayas states including Masbate침o (Region V), Western Visayas (Region VI; Hiligaynon, Kinaray-a, Aklanon and Capiznon), Central Visayas (Region VII; Cebuano, Negros Cebuano, Boholano & Siquijor) and Eastern Visayas (Region VIII; Waray and Leyte Kan칙).https://www.researchgate.net/figure/Visayan- language-distribution-map-source-https-commonswikimediaorg_fig1_373809747 There are the Visayan languages of state the Western Visayas are Ilonggos or "Hiligaynon" speakers, while in Central is Bisaya "Cebuano" and the Eastern is called Waray-Waray. ==Languages/dialects in regions== * Western Visayas (Region VI) ** Aklanon ** Capiznon ** Hiligaynon ** Kinaray-a * Central Visayas (Region VII) ** Negros Cebuano ** Standard Cebuano ** Boholano Cebuano * Eastern Visayas (Region VIII) ** Leyte Cebuano ** Standard Waray ===Outside of jurisdiction=== * Bicol Region (Region V) ** Masbate침o ** Sorsoganon ; Mindanao hilitribal languages * Davao Region (Region XI) ** Davaoe침o Cebuano * Mindanao ** Mindanao Cebuano ** Mindanao Hiligaynon ==Reference== Category:Languages of the Philippines
title: Visayan languages
